result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian C McGowen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments including DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to Extended Supervision shall be due immediately. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Completion of HSED or GED.  Maintain full time work and/or school.
Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.

No alcohol,.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not reside or work at a location where a firearm is present.
Defendant may not contact any gang memeber or associate.
**Under Section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Lana G. and  Donta S., as it is in the interest of the public protection to prohibit contact.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment inclduing drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statuts section 973.176, the Court advised the defendnt of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113, the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could  serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and any violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian C McGowen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Decision and Order Denying Motion to Vacate DNA Surcharge, signed and filed.
It is Hereby Ordered that the defendant's request to amend the judgment of conviction by vacating the DNA surcharge is DENIED. 
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se motion to vacate DNA surcharge.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court, defendant Brian C McGowen not in court, in custody. Defense counsel waives defendants appearance. Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Restitution Hearing proceeds. Arguments heard. For the reasons placed on the record the Court sets restitution at $0. Court denies the State's request for any further briefing.

Order, signed and filed.
The Court Orders the Clerk correct the Judgment of Conviction as requested, and send a copy of this Request and Order and the corrected judgment to the parties.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian C McGowen in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Brian C McGowen in custody. Patricia Daugherty for Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not reside or work at a location where a firearm is present.
- Defendant may not contact any gang member or associate.
- Completion of HSED or GED.
- Maintain full time work and/or school.
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Lana G. and Donta S.. as it is in the interest of the public protection to prohibit contact.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, and
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Case is adjourned for Status Conference on 2-2-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.






  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-Sentence Investigation report, received and filed. Report in file 14CF2363.
from Defendant written pro-se, received and filed.

Defendant Brian C McGowen in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Brian C McGowen in custody.  Patricia Daugherty for Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As a global resolution the Defendant proceeds with Plea Hearing. 
AS TO COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody pending sentencing.  
Final Pretrial scheduled for 12-3-2014 and Jury Trial scheduled for 12-15-2014 at 9:00 a.m. are vacated. 
Case adjourned for Sentencing on 1-16-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court, defendant Brian C McGowen not in court, in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 12-3-2014 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 12-15-2014 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Sever Cases- Nonevidentiary, received and filed.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court, defendant Brian C McGowen not in court, in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties heard on the Motion to Sever. Parties agree that case 14CF873 and 14CF2363 were never joined and there is no reason to sever cases. 
Case is adjourned for Scheduling Conference 9-9-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 8/20/2014 at 1:30 pm.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court, defendant Brian C McGowen not in court, in custody. Randy Sitzberger for Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court waives defendants appearance for todays proceedings.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Christopher J Cherella in court, defendant Brian C McGowen not in court, in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense needs time to review the discovery. Case calendared for STATUS on 7/28/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Brian C McGowen in court with attorney Christopher J Cherella.  Defendant Brian C McGowen in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Carl Buschmann-MCDA Investigator.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15 due to co-defendant's lower pending case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  .  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brian C McGowen in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Brian C McGowen in custody.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
